comments:
I am trying to generate a plugin that allows to edit xml files that have to 
follow a specific XML schema. 

I am essentially following the example in the tutorial "Generating an EMF Model 
using XML Schema" document (see
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/scripts/docs.php?
doc=tutorials/xlibmod/xlibmod.html).

When using the supplied library.xsd example-file everything works fine, i.e. 
a "library"-editor is created which - when started in a runtime workbench - 
allows to edit library models and creates .xml files that adhere to the 
original library.xsd schema.

When I try to do the very same with our own schema (which - BTW - I checked 
with the SchemaQualityChecker downloaded from alphaworks, just to make sure) 
the generation of the model, the .edit and .editor project work all fine. 
However, when I then try to create an instance of our model using the 
corresponding entry in File => New => Example EMF Model Creation Wizards => 
OurModel, then accepting the proposed file-name and parent directory and 
choosing one of our models possible "model objects", then - depending on the 
chosen object (our schema allows three possible elements) - either:

- nothing happens, i.e. no model is created at all. Unfortunately this happens 
exactly with our intended root element.
or
- a model is created but the ResourceSet view does not display any DocumentRoot 
entry and the generated files has a length of zero bytes
or
a Document Root is selected and everything works as expected, one can edit a 
subtree of elements under that root.

In the first case in the console I get the following exeption:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

In the second case, there is no indication whatsoever, why no document root is 
created.

Regards,
Michael

The problem was that the model creation in the wizard assumed that the root 
element's type would be in the same package as the element.  The fix to the 
template is committed to CVS.
This is fixed in the latest driver.
